name: Organization Context Ontology
description: Rich organizational context hub linking products, brands, competitive landscape, market segments, and maturity levels. Foundation layer bridge connecting ORG entities to domain-specific ontologies via the context hub pattern.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Organization Context
hasDefinedTerm.description: Rich context container for an organization linking to all contextual sub-entities including products, brands, competitive landscape, market context, and maturity assessment
hasDefinedTerm.skos:note: Central hub entity — all other ORG-CONTEXT entities connect through this

org-ctx:properties.name: Context ID
org-ctx:properties.description: Unique identifier for this organizational context instance

org-ctx:properties.name: Organization Reference
org-ctx:properties.description: Reference to the core organization entity in the ORG ontology

org-ctx:properties.name: Products
org-ctx:properties.description: Organization's products or services offered to market

org-ctx:properties.name: Brands
org-ctx:properties.description: Organization's brand portfolio

org-ctx:properties.name: Value Proposition References
org-ctx:properties.description: References to value propositions defined in VSOM ontology — details live there, not here

org-ctx:properties.name: Product Portfolio
org-ctx:properties.description: Full product or service portfolio structure

org-ctx:properties.name: Competitive Landscape
org-ctx:properties.description: Competitive environment context for the organization

org-ctx:properties.name: Market Context
org-ctx:properties.description: Market segments, geography, and localization context

org-ctx:properties.name: Maturity
org-ctx:properties.description: Organization maturity assessment across multiple dimensions

hasDefinedTerm.name: Product
hasDefinedTerm.description: Product or service offered by the organization to its target market segments

org-ctx:properties.name: Product ID
org-ctx:properties.description: Unique identifier for this product

org-ctx:properties.name: Product Name
org-ctx:properties.description: Display name of the product or service

org-ctx:properties.name: Product Description
org-ctx:properties.description: Brief description of the product's purpose and offering

org-ctx:properties.name: Category
org-ctx:properties.description: Product category classification

org-ctx:properties.name: Product Segment
org-ctx:properties.description: Product segment within the portfolio

org-ctx:properties.name: Product Status
org-ctx:properties.description: Current lifecycle status: active, discontinued, or planned

org-ctx:properties.name: Product Value Proposition
org-ctx:properties.description: Reference to product-level value proposition in VSOM ontology if different from brand-level

hasDefinedTerm.name: Brand
hasDefinedTerm.description: Brand owned by the organization, carrying its own market identity and value proposition

org-ctx:properties.name: Brand ID
org-ctx:properties.description: Unique identifier for this brand

org-ctx:properties.name: Brand Name
org-ctx:properties.description: Display name of the brand

org-ctx:properties.name: Brand Description
org-ctx:properties.description: Brief description of the brand's identity and positioning

org-ctx:properties.name: Is Primary Brand
org-ctx:properties.description: Whether this is the organization's primary brand

org-ctx:properties.name: Brand Value Proposition
org-ctx:properties.description: Reference to brand-level value proposition in VSOM ontology

hasDefinedTerm.name: Product Portfolio
hasDefinedTerm.description: Structured view of the organization's complete product and service offerings across segments

org-ctx:properties.name: Portfolio Type
org-ctx:properties.description: Classification of portfolio structure: single_product, multi_product, ecommerce, service, or hybrid

org-ctx:properties.name: Product Count
org-ctx:properties.description: Approximate number of products in the portfolio

org-ctx:properties.name: Portfolio Segments
org-ctx:properties.description: Product segments within the portfolio

hasDefinedTerm.name: Competitive Landscape
hasDefinedTerm.description: Competitive environment context encompassing named competitors, Porter-style forces, and macro trends affecting the organization's market position
hasDefinedTerm.skos:note: Competitors can exist at multiple levels: platform, client org, client's client

org-ctx:properties.name: Competitors
org-ctx:properties.description: Named competitors with strengths, weaknesses, and strategic posture analysis

org-ctx:properties.name: Competitive Forces
org-ctx:properties.description: Porter-style forces: threat of entry, substitutes, buyer power, supplier power, rivalry

org-ctx:properties.name: Trends
org-ctx:properties.description: Macro trends affecting the competitive landscape: regulatory, technological, economic, social

hasDefinedTerm.name: Competitor
hasDefinedTerm.description: Named competitor organization with competitive analysis including type, priority, strengths, weaknesses, and strategic posture

org-ctx:properties.name: Organization Reference
org-ctx:properties.description: Reference to the competitor's entry in the ORG ontology

org-ctx:properties.name: Competitor Type
org-ctx:properties.description: Classification: direct, indirect, aspirational, or substitute

org-ctx:properties.name: Priority Ranking
org-ctx:properties.description: Threat priority ranking from 1 (highest) to 5 (lowest)

org-ctx:properties.name: Strengths
org-ctx:properties.description: Competitor's key competitive strengths

org-ctx:properties.name: Weaknesses
org-ctx:properties.description: Competitor's key competitive weaknesses

org-ctx:properties.name: Strategic Posture
org-ctx:properties.description: Current strategic stance: aggressive, defensive, expanding, contracting, or stable

org-ctx:properties.name: Track Citations
org-ctx:properties.description: Whether to track AI platform citations for this competitor

org-ctx:properties.name: Track Rankings
org-ctx:properties.description: Whether to track search rankings for this competitor

hasDefinedTerm.name: Competitive Force
hasDefinedTerm.description: Porter-style competitive force analysing structural market pressure including threat of entry, substitutes, buyer and supplier power, and competitive rivalry

org-ctx:properties.name: Force Type
org-ctx:properties.description: Porter force classification: threat_of_new_entrants, threat_of_substitutes, bargaining_power_buyers, bargaining_power_suppliers, competitive_rivalry

org-ctx:properties.name: Intensity
org-ctx:properties.description: Force intensity level: low, medium, or high

org-ctx:properties.name: Description
org-ctx:properties.description: Narrative description of this competitive force's impact

org-ctx:properties.name: Key Factors
org-ctx:properties.description: Specific factors driving this competitive force

hasDefinedTerm.name: Trend
hasDefinedTerm.description: Macro trend affecting the market landscape including regulatory, technological, economic, social, environmental, and political forces

org-ctx:properties.name: Trend Type
org-ctx:properties.description: PESTEL classification: regulatory, technological, economic, social, environmental, political

org-ctx:properties.name: Trend Name
org-ctx:properties.description: Descriptive name for the macro trend

org-ctx:properties.name: Trend Description
org-ctx:properties.description: Narrative description of the trend and its implications

org-ctx:properties.name: Impact
org-ctx:properties.description: Direction of impact: positive, negative, neutral, or uncertain

org-ctx:properties.name: Timeframe
org-ctx:properties.description: Expected impact horizon: immediate, short_term, medium_term, long_term

hasDefinedTerm.name: Market Context
hasDefinedTerm.description: Market segments, geographic scope, customer needs, and localization context defining the organization's addressable market

org-ctx:properties.name: Market Segments
org-ctx:properties.description: Target industries, geographies, and customer segments

org-ctx:properties.name: Customer Needs
org-ctx:properties.description: High-level jobs-to-be-done and pain points — detailed analysis lives in VSOM ontology

org-ctx:properties.name: Geographic Scope
org-ctx:properties.description: Operating regions and geographic markets served

org-ctx:properties.name: Localization
org-ctx:properties.description: Localization requirements including base currency, geography, and supported languages

hasDefinedTerm.name: Market Segment
hasDefinedTerm.description: Target market segment defined by industry, geography, size, and strategic priority for the organization

org-ctx:properties.name: Segment ID
org-ctx:properties.description: Unique identifier for this market segment

org-ctx:properties.name: Segment Name
org-ctx:properties.description: Descriptive name for the market segment

org-ctx:properties.name: Industry
org-ctx:properties.description: Industry vertical this segment belongs to

org-ctx:properties.name: Geography
org-ctx:properties.description: Geographic region for this segment

org-ctx:properties.name: Segment Size
org-ctx:properties.description: Estimated addressable market size for this segment

org-ctx:properties.name: Priority
org-ctx:properties.description: Strategic priority: primary, secondary, or emerging

hasDefinedTerm.name: Customer Need
hasDefinedTerm.description: High-level customer need identifier for jobs-to-be-done, pain points, and value drivers — detailed pains and gains analysis lives in VSOM ontology

org-ctx:properties.name: Need ID
org-ctx:properties.description: Unique identifier for this customer need

org-ctx:properties.name: Need Type
org-ctx:properties.description: Classification: job_to_be_done, pain_point, value_driver, or unmet_need

org-ctx:properties.name: Need Description
org-ctx:properties.description: Description of the customer need and its business impact

org-ctx:properties.name: Priority
org-ctx:properties.description: Urgency and importance: critical, high, medium, or low

hasDefinedTerm.name: Organization Maturity
hasDefinedTerm.description: Multi-dimensional maturity assessment covering size, value delivery, marketing, technology, complexity management, and AI readiness

org-ctx:properties.name: Size Maturity
org-ctx:properties.description: Size maturity level (1-5) based on financial scale and headcount

org-ctx:properties.name: Value Maturity
org-ctx:properties.description: Value delivery maturity level (1-5)

org-ctx:properties.name: Marketing Maturity
org-ctx:properties.description: Marketing capability maturity level (1-5) including team structure and functional roles

org-ctx:properties.name: Technology Maturity
org-ctx:properties.description: Technology and digital maturity level (1-5)

org-ctx:properties.name: Complexity Maturity
org-ctx:properties.description: Complexity management maturity level (1-5)

org-ctx:properties.name: AI Maturity
org-ctx:properties.description: AI-specific maturity assessment: unaware, exploring, experimenting, implementing, optimizing

relationships.name: hasPortfolio

relationships.name: hasMarketContext

relationships.name: hasMaturity
relationships.description: An OrganizationContext has one maturity assessment across all dimensions

relationships.name: productInPortfolio

relationships.name: hasCompetitors

relationships.name: hasForces

relationships.name: hasTrends

relationships.name: hasSegments

relationships.name: hasCustomerNeeds

relationships.name: trendImpacts

relationships.name: contextForOrganization
relationships.description: An ORG Organization has a rich context defined in this ontology via the bridge pattern

relationships.name: hasValueProposition
relationships.description: OrganizationContext references value propositions defined in the VSOM ontology

relationships.name: brandValueProposition
relationships.description: A Brand has a value proposition defined in the VSOM ontology

relationships.name: productValueProposition
relationships.description: A Product may have a product-level value proposition in the VSOM ontology

businessRules.name: ContextRequiresOrganization
businessRules.description: Every OrganizationContext must reference a valid organization from the ORG ontology

businessRules.name: CompetitorLimit
businessRules.description: A CompetitiveLandscape should have no more than 10 tracked competitors for focus

businessRules.name: MaturityScoresRange
businessRules.description: All maturity dimension scores must be integers between 1 and 5
businessRules.action: THEN all maturity levels BETWEEN 1 AND 5

businessRules.name: ValuePropositionReferenceOnly
businessRules.description: OrganizationContext only references value propositions — detailed pains, gains, solution, and ICP data lives in the VSOM ontology
businessRules.action: THEN vsom:ValueProposition reference IS valid AND NOT inline definition

businessRules.name: BrandMustBeNamed
businessRules.description: Every Brand must have a name for identification and market recognition

businessRules.name: SegmentShouldHaveNeeds
businessRules.description: Market segments should identify at least one customer need to justify targeting

crossOntologyReferences.description: ORG-CONTEXT is a Foundation layer hub bridging ORG entities to domain-specific ontologies. It receives organizational identity from ORG and references value propositions in VSOM. Competitive analysis entities align with CA and CL ontologies.

lineageAlignment.org:Organization: ORG provides the core organization entity that ORG-CONTEXT enriches with market context
lineageAlignment.vsom:ValueProposition: VSOM holds detailed value proposition definitions referenced by ORG-CONTEXT brands and products
lineageAlignment.ca:CompetitiveAnalysis: CA provides competitive analysis frameworks that complement ORG-CONTEXT competitor tracking
lineageAlignment.cl:CompetitiveLandscape: CL provides landscape models that ORG-CONTEXT competitive data feeds into
